intro: Pluchea paniculata var. jacquemontii, commonly known as the golden cupplant, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has basal leaves that are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stem is hairy and often branched. It thrives in moist, sunny habitats such as wetlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important plant for both ecological and ornamental purposes.
